meanings.definition: A shaft that is below or subordinate to another shaft.
meanings.sent1: The miners descended into the dark subshafts to extract valuable minerals.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building with sturdy subshafts to support the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnomes used the subshafts as secret tunnels to play pranks on the miners.
meanings.sent4: The subshafts of society quietly support the main pillars of progress.
meanings.sent5: The subshafts were like hidden passageways leading to hidden treasures.

meanings.definition: The lower part of a shaft or column.
meanings.sent1: The workers reinforced the crumbling subshafts of the ancient tower.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully carved intricate designs into the subshafts of the marble column.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel peeked into the subshafts, hoping to find a hidden acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The subshafts stood strong, bearing the weight of the towering structure above.
meanings.sent5: The subshafts resembled the roots of a great tree, anchoring the column in place.

meanings.sent1: The engineers installed additional subshafts to improve ventilation in the mine.
meanings.sent2: The factory had multiple subshafts to channel different materials to the production line.
meanings.sent3: The playful kittens turned the subshafts into their own miniature obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: The subshafts branched out like tributaries, serving various functions in the system.
meanings.sent5: The subshafts were like loyal assistants, supporting the main shaft in its duties.
